fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Next Sprint Due (auto) in the Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget and Sprint Health Gadget chooses the sprint which is in top of the active sprints list. This doesn't work well when parallel sprints is enabled because each active sprint can have different due date and the top one doesn't necessarily have the most recent due date.   

h3. Suggested Solution
Consider the due dates of parallel active sprints, and choose the one which has the most recent due date for the Next Sprint Due (auto).
fields.summary: Next Sprint Due (auto) should pick an active sprint based on due date when parallel sprints enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is possible to create duplicates in regard to card colors per rapid board, since there is no unique constraint on AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR, I understand possibly allowing some JQL and colors to be duplicated, but priority and assignee with the same color, makes little sense. 
{code:sql}
                                   Table "public.AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR"
    Column     |          Type          |                             Modifiers                              
---------------+------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------
 COLOR         | character varying(255) | 
 ID            | bigint                 | not null default nextval('"AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR_ID_seq"'::regclass)
 POS           | integer                | not null default 0
 RAPID_VIEW_ID | bigint                 | not null
 STRATEGY      | character varying(255) | 
 VAL           | character varying(255) | 
Indexes:
    "AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree ("ID")
    "index_ao_60db71_car2031978979" btree ("RAPID_VIEW_ID")
Foreign-key constraints:
    "fk_ao_60db71_cardcolor_rapid_view_id" FOREIGN KEY ("RAPID_VIEW_ID") REFERENCES "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"("ID"){code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a new board 
 # use the following REST API to create duplicates: 

{code:java}
curl -X POST \curl -X POST \  http://10.125.91.7:8080/jira71312/rest/greenhopper/1.0/cardcolors/1/color \  -H 'authorization: Basic YWRtaW46c3BoZXJl' \  -H 'cache-control: no-cache' \  -H 'content-type: application/json' \  -H 'postman-token: 25809661-1580-cc17-9eb4-53cf46fab002' \  -d '{ "color": "#cc0000",  "value": "admin ","strategy": "assignee"}' {code}
I'm expecting this could be scripted easily in something like script runner also. 
h3. Expected Results

Jira would _not_ allow duplicated card colors for the same type and value
h3. Actual Results

Jira allows duplicates since there is no unique constraint on AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR

!image-2020-04-24-09-13-34-949.png!
h3. Workaround

You can either use the GUI to delete these manually or backup the table and delete the entries manually, example query:
{code:java}
 delete from "AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR" where "ID" in (<IDS of duplicates>);{code}
fields.summary: Creating a duplicate card color does not cause a unique constraint error for each board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Boards with more than 1 Quick Filters applied, using the Watch function in the Quick view (not Issue directly) of the selected Issue would cause Error 500. This seems to be due to the URL changing to an incorrect form when the page refreshes.
(i) Affects both Watch and Unwatch actions
(i) Affects both Scrum and Kanban Boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Board
# Apply 2 Quick Filters
** Take note of the URL
# Click 1 Issue to prompt the Quick View
# Click the ellipsis icon (three dots) in the Quick View then click 'Watch Issue' or 'Stop watching'
# The page will refresh and the Error 500 occurs
** Notice the URL has changed to an incorrect form

h3. Expected Results
The URL maintains the correct form while the page refreshes

Expected URL would look like this
(i) Note this is not the full URL. Also the IDs would be dependent on each use case
{code}
rapidView=3&view=planning&selectedIssue=SSP-24&quickFilter=6&quickFilter=13&issueLimit=100
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The URL changes to an incorrect form while the page refreshes, leading to Error 500

The incorrect URL would look like this:
{code}
rapidView=3&view=planning&selectedIssue=SSP-24&quickFilter=6%2C13&quickFilter=6%2C13&issueLimit=100
{code}
Notice the '%2C' part followed by the ID of the subsequent filter(s)

h3. Workaround
* Watch/Unwatch the Issue in the direct Issue Details view (not from the Quick view in the Board)
* Upgrade to Jira 8.8.0 (this version has been tested not facing this Bug)
fields.summary: Watch function in Boards causes Error 500 when using multiple Quick Filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Every now and then we are getting complaints from our users saying that they either cannot attach files to existing issues or that they are unable to create a certain issue after they have filled a certain amount of information in the Create Issue screen. Users complain this is unproductive. In both cases they see a message saying the security token was missing or was invalid.

We advise the users to refresh the page and that usually works for them, however this is not efficient. Please find below the comment of one of our users:

"Yes, the page recovers on a refresh, but I loose all the data I had entered on the page if I have to refresh. I commonly have to take more than an hour to get the data in a page collected(called into a meeting, need to grab screenshots from multiple tools in a lengthy process etc). Prior to expiring my token, the system should cache my data so I can pick it up and continue where i left off, or I should be warned my token is expiring. Or the system should not let me enter data if my token is expired. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira
 # Let the session be inactive until the session expires or redirect the user request to a different node.
 # Start filling a form in Jira, this can be any form which would be submitted to Jira, for example, creating an issue or updating comments.
 # Submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

For the should retain the data in the form fields.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
XSRF Security Token Missing
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: XSRF token error results in missing form data.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
+PROBLEM:+ When you set up a Subscription for a Saved Filter, you are limited with properties to manage the content of E-mails.

Specifically, no possibility to define -
 * *subject for emails* (it's a Filter Name what is taken as email subject, no chance to override it with any custom text)
 * *email body* as some additional text to place above the list of issues

+USE CASE:+ I set up several subscriptions by saved filters for my team to timely remind important things - for example to log time on closed tasks, to set Story Points for anything taken into current sprint, and a few more.  Overall purpose - maintain a higher culture of reporting and transparency about the development process. 

+RATIONALE:+ So, when a filter triggers a subscription to send out email, I feel the ability to add subject and body to emails would increase the efficiency of those notifications because it would clearly explain to people a) the reason of such emails, b) what they need to do, and c) what will happen to them if they don't do what I ask :)

Thank you. Hope this sounds as a useful enhancement although quite easy to implement because it just slightly extends the attributes of available components, no new rockets.
fields.summary: Ability to extend Subscription properties with a subject and comment for email

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*CONTEXT:* For epics consisting of a large number of items (20+) it is necessary to review their implementation status on a regular basis. The easiest (and fasted) way today is to go to the epic and see its "Issues in Epic" panel. It shows all items within this epic, with a few attributes near each like type, assignee, status.

*PAIN:* when an epic is in progress, i.e. some its items in it are already done, others not yet started, others are in progress, it is hard to cognitively 'filter' remaining work (i.e. issues by statuses). But this is important - to quickly get a clear picture of the incomplete stuff. The workaround is simple - _manually_ go to issues search, build a new filter, choose appropriate project for that filter, then choose epic in question, then choose statuses of issues. Lots of clicks, lots of time wasted.

*SUGGESTION:* add ability for 'one-click' filtering by statuses right within the "Issues by Epic" panel. That would reduce time needed to prepare reviews, and thus will increase a productivity of teams.

*HINT:* In another panel within an issue called "Sub-Tasks" there's a menu available, with items like "Show ALL", "Show Open", "Open in Issues Navigator".  IMO if the same menu+functions become available for the "Issues in Epic" panel - that would be fantastic!!  I don't think anything more advanced is needed at this point.

Thank you! Hope this suggestion will be considered sooner )
fields.summary: Ability to filter items in "Issues in Epic" by statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dashboard owner will lose the ability to edit their dashboard if they are removed from a group that the dashboard was shared with.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add dashboard owner to a group
# Share their dashboard with this group
# Remove the dashboard owner from the group


h3. Expected Results
Dashboard owner should still be able to edit their dashboard within the dashboard page.
 !while in group.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Dashboard owner no longer able to edit their dashboard within the dashboard page.
 !removed from group.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add the dashboard owner back to the group or go to the *manage dashboard* page and remove the group from the share.

h3. Suggestion
# Let the dashboard owner know via warning message that group needs to be removed from the share as it no longer exists or they no longer are part of that group before they can change the layout and add gadgets on the dashboard page.
# Or silently remove the group from the dashboard share as the owner is no longer part of the group or the group no longer exists.
fields.summary: Dashboard not editable on dashboard page if owner is removed from group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Sprint field suggestion is calculated based on users' last 5 visited Sprint. If a user has not to visit a minimum of 5 Sprint, the suggestion will be calculated by retrieving ALL SPRINT available to the user and perform some calculation to return number issues associated with each Sprint.

For some Jira configurations, the _Sprint_ field dropdown suggestion may consume a lot of CPU, see JSWSERVER-20445
h3. Suggested Solution

Don't calculate _"All sprints"_ suggestion for those cases.
h3. Fix

It is activated by using this feature flag:
 {{com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.sprint.picker.allsprints.suggestion.disabled}}
 As soon as this flag is added, "All sprints" suggestion will not be calculated/shown.
h3. Important note

The limitation of this workaround is that users can only search/select Sprints from their own history (the Sprints that they have visited/edited/created).
If the user has not created/edited/visited any sprint and the dark feature is enabled, the drop-down will be empty.
fields.summary: As a Jira Agile user I would like to be able not loading "All sprints" suggestion for sprint picker

When accessing Issues directly without going through the Board (e.g. via Filter), the associated Board would still appear in 'Recent Boards' list. This also proves to be problematic for Issues with multiple Boards associated, as the Board that would be displayed in 'Recent Boards' list would be random, thus making the list inaccurate.

# Create a new user
# Login as the new user
# Notice the 'Recent Boards' list (in 'Boards' header) is empty
# Go to 'Issues' > 'Search for issues'. Search for 1 of the Issues.
# Access the issue directly
# Check the 'Recent Boards' list
(i) You might need to refresh the page
** The Board associated to the Issue would appear, despite the user not accessing the Board itself.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Recent Boards' list would not display the Boards when accessing the Issues directly

h3. Actual Results
Boards would be displayed in the 'Recent Boards' list when accessing the associated Issues directly.

h3. Workaround
None

h3. Issue Summary

In the Jira Introduction page, when a PDF attachment is hyperlinked within the HTML code, the page breaks when the user clicks the hyperlink. The pdf file is hosted within the same Jira server. This is mainly observed in Jira 8.x release
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Place a pdf file in the Jira Web server.
 # Hyperlink this file in an HTML code and place it in the Jira Introduction page.
 # When the user clicks this link, the page breaks. Please find the screenshots attached.

h3. Expected Results

When the user clicks the link, the pdf should open in a new browser window without any problems.
h3. Actual Results

Page breaks as shown in the screenshot attached.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to host the pdf file outside the Jira web server and then use that location in the HTML code.
fields.summary: Hyperlinking PDF document in Jira Introduction breaks in Jira 8.x

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of the incomplete issues can be moved to a backlog, not to a new sprint, if we close the sprint from a board with a different filter than sprint was started, even if the complete sprint dialog said that all incomplete issue will be moved to a new sprint.

It is because complete sprint dialog shows the number of incomplete issues based on the sprint custom field. However, Jira moves issues based on the board filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the new scrum project. Project name - *Da*,
 # Create 6 issues. Issue names - *1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6*,
 # For the issues *2,4,6* set the fix version to *1.0*,
 # Create new sprint,
 # Move *all* the issues to a new sprint,
 # Start new sprint,
 # Move issues *3* and *4* to "*In-progress*" state,
 # Move issues *5* and *6* to "*Done*" state.
 !image-2020-03-25-10-01-16-409.png!
 # Change the board filter from
{code:java}
project = DA ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}
to
{code:java}
 project = DA AND fixVersion = 1.0 ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}
!image-2020-03-25-10-12-22-126.png!

 # Complete the sprint and move the incomplete issues to New sprint
 !image-2020-03-25-10-05-07-633.png!

h3. Expected Results

There are two potential fixes.

First one:
 * Complete sprint dialog shows a number of the issues in the sprint - works like now

 * Jira moves all incomplete issues to destiny sprint not only those on the current board - works differently

Second one:
 * Complete sprit dialog shows a number of the issues based on the current board - works differently

 * Jira moves incomplete issues from the current board a to destiny sprint and remains issues to a backlog - works like now

h3. Actual Results

Complete sprint dialog shows a number of the issues in the sprint
 !image-2020-03-25-10-05-07-633.png!

Issues *2,4* are moved to a new sprint and issues *1,3* get back to backlog. To see 1,3 issues you need to get back to old filter or create a new board.
 !image-2020-03-25-10-27-39-248.png!
h3. Workaround

Do not change the filter rather create the new board with a new filter and complete the sprint from the old board where the filter returns all the issues from the sprint.
fields.summary: Closing the sprint on different board than it was started can cause that some issue will land in the backlog.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h1. Summary

Permission Schemes are tricky to manage, especially when there are so many individual permissions to consider.  The most basic permission for a Jira Project is the Browse Projects permissions, without almost nothing works.

However, once we have the Browse Issue permission there is no current way to say, all users with the basic browse permission in this project should have other permissions.  Instead, every single permission must be explicitly stated.  The alternative is to use the "Any Logged In Users" under Application Access or "Anyone on the web" under Group. 

Neither of the two options is great from an Audit and Security point of view and can lead to confusion when Project Administrators look at their project's permission schemes and think "Why does everyone have access to my project?"
h1. Suggestion

My suggestion is to add a reference to another permission or at least to the Browse Projects permission.  Doing this would make it possible to grant a single permission to an explicit group or role and then the other permissions can reference the explicit grant.
h3. Short Example:

Groups 1, 2, 3 and Roles A, B

Permissions:
 * Browse Project
 * Create Issues
 * Add Comments
 * Create Attachments
 * View Read-Only Workflow.

With the current model of Permission Schemes, if I want to grant the above permissions to each listed groups and roles, I would need to add each to every permission.
 * Browse Project - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B
 * Create Issues - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B
 * Add Comments - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B
 * Create Attachments - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B
 * View Read-Only Workflow - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B

And then, if I need to remove Group 2 from access, I have to painfully remove it from each permission one at a time
h3. New and Improved

With the suggestion a Permission Scheme could look like this:
 * Browse Project - Group 1, Group 2, Group 3, Role A, Rold B
 * Create Issues - All users with Browse Project permissions
 * Add Comments - All users with Browse Project permissions
 * Create Attachments - All users with Browse Project permissions
 * View Read-Only Workflow. - All users with Browse Project permissions

Then if I need to remove a group from access, it is only from a single permission holder.
fields.summary: New Permission Grantee Type in Permission Schemes

fields.description:
*Problem:*
 Improve our documentation regarding the use of the Atlassian Scheduled tasks.

 

*Use Case:*
 Following the instructions at [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/developing-for-high-availability-and-clustering/#PluginGuidetoJIRAHighAvailabilityandClustering-Scheduledtasksandbackgroundprocesses], the following structure was created:
 * We have used one Atlassian Scheduled tasks for each "master" project;
 * This can lead to multiple scheduled tasks for each "master" project;
 * Each of these scheduled tasks will start their own threads;
 * The task execution waits for the thread to finish and provide feedback to the Atlassian Scheduler API.

However, this structure had occupied some of the Caesium threads and impacted others Jira scheduled tasks like notification.

 

*It was recommended from Atlassian to:*
 1) There is a hardy limit of 4 Caesium threads;

2) We should not submit any job to the scheduler, which does not return in a short time;

3) Instead of returning the result to the scheduler (by calling JobRunnerResponse.success(); or JobRunnerResponse.failed(exp.getMessage()), it should return immediately after starting the job with success code, and implement a callback to call it back, for example something like VcsJobRegistry.isComplete(vcsProjectId) etc.

On the analogy above, this is like scheduler thread call another thread, gives the job and continues it’s own work (other jobs).

The job has an address to call on it, so when it’s complete, the new thread calls this number to tell it’s done.

4) Or we should use it's own thread pool and submit jobs to that thread pool, creating the pool (i.e. ExecutorService executor = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(5)) while setting the needed pool size. 
 (!) Watch for the quantity of resources used from JVM to leave some space to Jira

5) If you use ExecutorService as it was suggested, please review the information about thread wrappers here:
 [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.2.8/com/atlassian/jira/util/thread/OffRequestThreadExecutorImpl.html]

 

Please add these recommendations to the Developer page at [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/developing-for-high-availability-and-clustering/#PluginGuidetoJIRAHighAvailabilityandClustering-Scheduledtasksandbackgroundprocesses]
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, we would like to have a better documentation regarding the scheduler threads usage

Incorrect reporting for custom fields (Sprint) in JQL search after a change from linked application fisheye/crucible

 # Run a JQL to search based on a custom field so that it returns newly created ticket.
 # The ticket is shown as expected
 # Make some changes in fisheye for this ticket. Try few times - open in 5-6 windows in parallel to reproduce the issue easily.

 # Make some change in fisheye for this ticket.

* Ticket should not be shown as it was moved to different sprint.

h3. Actual Results
* Ticket is shown in the incorrect sprint.

h3. Workaround
* Perform a full reindex.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Software Server you can [restrict editing authorization per status|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-limit-editing-permission-to-certain-groups-for-a-particular-issue-status-802171723.html] (e.g. Approved) to a particular group by setting "jira.permission.edit.group" to a particular group (e.g. Approvers). It means, that only users belonging to the group "Approvers" can edit an issue when it is in status "Approved". Creating an Epic Link requires edit permissions for both linked issues. When you try to create an Epic Link as a user, that is not a member of the group specified in "jira.permission.edit.group" setting your attempt will fail (which is expected). Unfortunately, message confirming successful creation of an Epic Link will be displayed anyway. It is misleading and confusing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group "Approvers" (user, that you use to reproduce this steps *must not be* in this group).
 # Set property of a status (e.g. "Approved") in project's workflow: jira.permission.edit.group.1 -> Approvers.
 # Create an Epic (e.g. ABC-100).
 # Create a Story (e.g. ABC-200) and keep it in Backlog.
 # Move the Epic to Approved status.
 # Edit Story -> Put "ABC-100" in Epic Link field.
 # Click on "Update" button (bottom-right).
 # Pop-up will be displayed "ABC-200 has been updated".
 # Verify that no link has been created in Epic nor Story.

h3. Expected Results

Message stating, that Epic Link creation failed due to lack of required permissions.
h3. Actual Results

The below confirmation message is displayed:
{noformat}
ABC-200 has been updated
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Do not use "jira.permission.edit.group" setting.
 # Add user to the group specified in "jira.permission.edit.group" setting.
 # Add a group, that the user is a member of to "jira.permission.edit.group" setting.
fields.summary: Failed attempt to create an Epic Link displays message confirming its successful creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While Jira Data Center does support ability to add and remove nodes from it's cluster easily without downtime, currently Jira Data Center doesn't natively support immediate or automatic provisioning of new nodes to respond to increased load. 
* We don't actually recommend for AWS users to use the auto scaling feature available in that platform for Jira Data Center due to the amount of time it actually takes to provision a node. 
* Also sticky sessions may require that existing sessions don't get immediately distributed to new nodes to balance load, even if we are able to instantly provision the nodes. 

This is a limitation for enterprise Data Center users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend data center support for instant scalability, including ability to manage sessions across multiple nodes to fully take advantage of instant scalability when new nodes are added.
fields.summary: Instant scalability with multi-node session management for Jira Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At times bulk deletion of projects are carried out to clean up the instance and reduce the load on the index. During deletion of the projects, the instance becomes unusable and causes significant performance degrade. Customer analysis shows that this originates from the large number of queries being run in the database individually rather than in batches and very frequently. The time taken for individual query, even though smaller adds up significantly in total, when the database is located remotely.

 !Database_query.png|thumbnail! 

Our Analysis shows that this is because to in the delete command, the code around workflows & workflow schemes doesn’t batch the database calls so well. Moreover, we’re often accessing these workflows through caches—yet we clear the caches partway through the process (before dealing with draft workflows) owing to the fix for JRASERVER-8032
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 200 - 300 test projects with one or more test issues using data generator plugin.
 # Try deletion of the projects in bulk using a plugin such as REST API or BobSwift CLI, the instance experiences large number of calls to the database contending with other normal user operations.

h3. Expected Results

The project deletion should not cause significant performance degrade.

h3. Actual Results

Project deletion causes the instance to become unusable and causes performance degradation.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior except to perform the deletion during any available maintenance period if possible.
fields.summary: Bulk deletion of projects even with zero issues is very slow and decreases performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempting to move an issue from a custom sub-task type to default Sub-task issue type will fail with an "*issue type selected is invalid*" error. Regardless of the issue type scheme used by the project, the new target issue type is validated against the *Default Issue Type Scheme*, which _does_ _not_ include Sub-Task in Jira Software.

This behavior looks to be an offshoot of JRASERVER-46227 — which was fixed for parent tasks — but the issue persists for sub-task issue types.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira software (reproduced in 7.x and 8.x)
 # Create a new Software project
 # Create a new sub-task issue type, e.g. "Test Sub-Task"
 # Assign the new sub-task issue type to the project's issue type scheme
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 10.50.24 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create a new issue in the project of the new sub-task issue type
 # Attempt to move the issue _within the same project_ and change the issue type to "Sub-Task"
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 10.46.11 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The issue is moved to the new issue type.

h3. Actual Results
We'll receive an "issue type selected is invalid" error:
!Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 10.46.03 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
You can change the issue type using the bulk edit feature on the issue search page. Follow the instructions for moving issues in [our knowledge-base article on editing multiple issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver085/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-981157689.html].

If bulk edit is not an acceptable workaround, you can follow the advice in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error] to add the default Sub-Task issue type to the Default Issue Type scheme.
fields.summary: Jira throws 'issue type selected is invalid error' when moving an issue to the default Sub-Task issue type

- User added to the shared dashboard to have the Edit permission, doesn't get/have the edit permission if the user is not part of the group which has been granted Edit permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User 1 has created a dashboard and giving permission to a group 1 (which the user1 is member of)
 # User 1 can give edit permission only to the group that he is a member of and cannot get the list of other groups that he is not part of, there is an existing [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15900] has been created to have that feature (_The user or the admin, can list other groups that they or not part of can be added to Edit permission of shared dashboard_)
 # User's part of group 1 gets the Edit permission including the owner, who is user 1
 # If you are giving permission to another user, user2 who is not a member of group 1 will not get edit permission. (_If there is no group given edit permission other than this user2, then the dashboard is editable for this user 2_)
 # Giving edit permission to both groups and users still not possible in Jira.

h3. Expected Results
- The single user who is not a member of the group, (_which has granted to have the edit permission to the shared dashboard_) should get the Edit permission of the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
- The single-user still has only read access and doesn't get any Edit permission.

h3. Workaround
- Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, Software Projects use the simplified workflow and scheme, if creating a new scheme with a new issue type and associating that issue type to another workflow,  the statuses will not show up in the column configuration of the board. 

Here is an example from the table:
{code:java}
Jira851=> select * from workflowschemeentity;

  id   | scheme |                   workflow                   | issuetype

--------------------------------------------------------+----------

10000 |  10000 | classic default workflow                     | 0

10118 |  10102 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10000

10119 |  10102 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10002

10120 |  10102 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10001

10121 |  10102 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10004

10122 |  10102 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10003


10201 |  10100 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10000

10202 |  10100 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10002

10203 |  10100 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10001

10204 |  10100 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10004

10205 |  10100 | Software Simplified Workflow for Project FOO | 10003{code}
h3. As you can see there is no entry for the Jira workflow, it should at least have a fallback entry with issuetype=0, but this is missing, thus breaking the column mapping. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a new project
 # create a new issue type
 # create a new workflow scheme that associates the new issue type to the JIRA default workflow
 # associate the new scheme to the project
 # create a new board
 # select configure
 # select columns

h3. Expected Results

you should see all of the statuses of all workflows in the scheme and be able to map them to columns
h3. Actual Results

Only statuses from the implicit default workflow "Jira" are missing.
h3. Workaround

add an addtional issuetype to the JIRA workflow, then remove it, this should create an issuetype entry in workflowschemeentity
fields.summary: creating a new issue type in a workflow scheme that is not the simplified scheme leads to the statuses not showing up in board configurations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to Atlassian documentation ([How to control anonymous user access in a public Jira instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-control-anonymous-user-access-in-a-public-jira-instance-975031479.html]), customers can intentionally configure global permissions and project projects to explicitly allow anonymous access to the user picker (via Browse Users/Browse Projects permissions).

As of upgrade to Jira 8.4+ this anonymous access functionality breaks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start with Jira Server 7.13.0
 # Assign the following permissions
** _Browse Users Global Permission_: Group: "Anyone on the web"
** _Browse Projects Project Permission_: Group: "Anyone on the web"
# Confirm an anonymous user can access user picker (e.g. using REST API) 
# Upgrade Jira Server to 8.4+

h3. Expected Results

Anonymous access to user picker (either via API or create issue screen) functions as before, with Jira 7.13 (and earlier)

h3. Actual Results

Anonymous access to user picker is blocked, and the error below appears (within HAR file):
{noformat}"message":"Client must be authenticated to access this resource.","status-code":401{noformat}

h3. Workaround

*Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available*
fields.summary: Pre-configured anonymous access to user picker breaks upon upgrading to Jira 8.4+

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user logs time on an issue, and selects a date that is _before_ the issue creation date, these logged times will not appear within the Burndown Chart Report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Sprint, and then create and add an issue to it.
 # Start sprint, log time on the issue for a date *_before_* the issue creation date, and then close the issue.
 # Complete Sprint
 # View Burndown Chart for created Sprint

h3. Expected Results

Time logged before issue creation date would appear within report.
h3. Actual Results

Time logged before issue creation date does not appear within report.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Logged time, using a date before the issue creation date, does not appear on Burndown Report

fields.description:
(i) Not a bug, this is expected behavior of the AO library, see comment below.

h3. Issue Summary

Custom created database index in AO_60DB71_LEXORANK table gets dropped during Jira startup
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom database index in Lexorank table, e.g.:
{noformat}CREATE INDEX "index_ao_60db71_lex_Idx" ON "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" (ID, LOCK_HASH, LOCK_TIME);{noformat}
 # Restart Jira

h3. Expected Results

The index is retained in the database after the restart.
h3. Actual Results

The index gets removed during the startup.

Enabled SQL logging shows "DROP INDEX" command executed during startup in atlassian-jira.log:
{code:java}
2020-02-26 12:41:46,992 active-objects-init-JiraTenantImpl{id='system'}-0 DEBUG anonymous     [n.java.ao.sql] DROP INDEX public."index_ao_60db71_lex_Idx"{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom created database index in AO_60DB71_LEXORANK table gets dropped during Jira startup

If a Text Field (multi-line) was added to the detail view of a board configuration, it's not usable anymore - label needs all the space. The editor cannot use this board view and so he have to go to the edit screen of the issue (see screen).

Preferred solution like the Description field. After the desciption label is a break. So the input field is in a different line and it's enough space to edit the field with all the features.

 

We are using Jira v7.13.8.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrade JIRA from v7.13.8#713008-sha1:1606a5c to v8.6.1#806001-sha1:b7cf80b
 Some user giving us feedback about using Alt+s shortcut when editing the description, adding or editing comments it saving their actions in Rich Text Editor Visual mode.
 In Poland Alt+s is using for "ś" it's one of the diacritical marks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Windows using Internet Explorer or Microsoft Edge
 # Install keyboard layouts: Polish (Programmers)
 # Choose Visual mode.
 # While editing description or comment press AltGr + s to get character 'ś'.

h3. Expected Results

Character *'ś'* is showing upon pressing AltGr + s.
h3. Actual Results

It's blank and seems likely to have a refresh effect. However, it works fine in Firefox and Chrome using Visual and Text mode.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment. User can use Firefox and Chrome that has the correct behavior.
fields.summary: Rich text editor unable to set Polish character 'ś' in MS Edge using Visual Mode

fields.description:
We all know that in the workflow, if we set a condition to a transition, then that transition will NOT be shown if the condition(s) do not match. This is a good feature.

However, there are some cases where we don't want the transition to be totally hidden out, but rather want to show them as existed, yet dimmed out, and the users know that the action is available if certain rule is met.

Better if the dimmed out button can show a message when being clicked, giving us the option to tell users which conditions they need to fulfill to enable the transition.
fields.summary: Ability to show the Transitions that fails condition as Dimmed out instead of hidden

h3. Problem Definition
It's not possible to edit workflows used by a single project in text mode with the "Extended project administration" permission. This same permission allows the user to edit workflows in diagram mode.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users with the permission "Extended project administration" to edit workflows in text mode.

h3. Workaround
The current workaround is to temporarily assign the permission "jira-system-admin" to the user.
fields.summary: Allow users to edit workflows without the permission jira-system-admin

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating labels, the suggestions show both uppercase and lowercase suggestions, if both were previously created. This can be confusing to users, who might believe that both suggestions are different labels.

 !Label Suggestion.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
*1.* Locking the case of the labels, so that all labels are either uppercase or lowercase;

or

*2.* Changing the Suggestions list to only show labels either in uppercase or lowercase.

The solution should also contemplate what happens with labels that currently exist in uppercase and lowercase.

h3. Workaround
A possible workaround is to use third-party plugins like [Label Manager|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215469/label-manager-for-jira] or [ScriptRunner|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira] to manage the labels and limit what the users can add in this field.
fields.summary: Label suggestions are not case-insensitive

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am having a hard time multi-selecting projects from the applicable context of the custom fields. 

*Where?*
* Administration --> Issues --> Custom fields, choose a custom field, click on "Configure" 
* From Applicable contexts for scheme click on "Edit Configuration" 
* Under "Choose applicable context" click on "Apply to issues under selected projects"
* When selecting projects, you will have to click and hold CTRL+click to select a project/s.

*Problems*
* The issue here is you run into a big problem when you dont remember to press Ctrl next time you add a project: All other project selections will be deleted. 
* As well as this field has a huge problem handling of large numbers of projects, you don't remember what you selected then when checking you can unselect projects OR all project selections will be deleted.


*Suggestions* 
I would suggest the following:

# Adding box to "tick" select the project/s
# Adding scrolling bar into the field for easier navigations when having a large number of projects.
# Adding a search bar to help look for projects using their names to improve the handling of large numbers of projects.
# Adding another field that shows the selected/active projects list for an easier view of what projects you selected.
fields.summary: Improve the functions of the applicable context of the custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Fix Version is remove from JIRA issue when you edit the issue and change version from archive to unarchive simultaneously.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new issue in JIRA Software project which Fix Version field is visible.
# Create a new version. (Ex: *Version123*) in Project > Releases page.
# Add *Version123* to the new issue.
# On Releases page > Move *Version123* to archive.
# Open the issue in another page, click Edit issue. You would see the* Version123* is listed on Archived Fix Version/s field.
# On Releases page > Move back *Version123* to unarchive.
# Click *update* button on Issue detail page.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will show Version123 in the Fix Version field.

h3. Actual Results
Version123 is removed from the Fix Version field.

h3. Workaround
The only workaround at the moment is to refresh the edit issue page after making any changes on Releases page in JIRA.

(flag) The concern here is that, user might not aware and accidentally remove the Fix Version while Editing the issue and changing the Version at the same time.
fields.summary: Fix Version is remove from JIRA issue when you edit the issue and change version from archive to unarchive simultaneously

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Data Center environments it's a hassle to have to bypass the load balancer and visit each node individually in the browser to retrieve user session information (for example, when debugging bad automation or scripts). Exposing the same information via an admin-secured REST endpoint would be a big help in streamlining this process and allowing for automated tracking.
fields.summary: Expose Current User Sessions (CurrentUsersList.jspa) to REST

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Sprint field drawdown suggestion can be CPU hungry and take a long time to calculate due to the following hotspot 
 [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/jswserver/repos/jira-agile/browse/greenhopper/src/main/java/com/atlassian/greenhopper/web/rapid/sprint/SprintResource.java?at=230fa87c55fdb18d803279df30b333fa58086f4f#99]
{code:java}
  Set<Sprint> allMatches = check(sprintHelper.findSprintPickerAllMatches(user, suggestions, searchQuery, maxResults, excludeCompleted));{code}
!a.png|thumbnail!

The Sprint field suggestion is calculated based on users' last 5 visited Sprint. If a user has not to visit a minimum of 5 Sprint, the suggestion will be calculated by retrieving  ALL SPRINT available to the user and perform some calculation to return number issues associated with each Sprint.

In large instances, with 3M issues and 52K Sprints, this operation alone can take 2 minutes to complete and consume significant CPU. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-19 at 4.11.39 pm.png|thumbnail! 
  

In the thread dump, you will see the following thread exist in multiple threads (ie. longer than 60-180s)
{code:java}
url:/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query username:vkharisma
java.util.TreeMap.getEntry(TreeMap.java:359)
java.util.TreeMap.get(TreeMap.java:278)
org.apache.lucene.codecs.perfield.PerFieldPostingsFormat$FieldsReader.terms(PerFieldPostingsFormat.java:315)
org.apache.lucene.index.CodecReader.terms(CodecReader.java:106)
org.apache.lucene.search.TermQuery$TermWeight.getTermsEnum(TermQuery.java:122)
org.apache.lucene.search.TermQuery$TermWeight.scorer(TermQuery.java:90)
org.apache.lucene.search.Weight.scorerSupplier(Weight.java:113)
org.apache.lucene.search.LRUQueryCache$CachingWrapperWeight.scorerSupplier(LRUQueryCache.java:720)
org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.scorerSupplier(BooleanWeight.java:329)
org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.scorer(BooleanWeight.java:295)
org.apache.lucene.search.Weight.bulkScorer(Weight.java:147)
org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.bulkScorer(BooleanWeight.java:289)
org.apache.lucene.search.LRUQueryCache$CachingWrapperWeight.bulkScorer(LRUQueryCache.java:795)
org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:657)
org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:462)
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
com.atlassian.jira.index.UnmanagedIndexSearcher.search(UnmanagedIndexSearcher.java:9)
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
com.atlassian.jira.index.ManagedIndexSearcher.search(ManagedIndexSearcher.java:15)
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHitCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:178)
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHitCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:145)
com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.search.DefaultSearchService.searchCount(DefaultSearchService.java:130)
......
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintPermissionServiceImpl.getIssueCountForSprint(SprintPermissionServiceImpl.java:250)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintPermissionServiceImpl.canViewSprint(SprintPermissionServiceImpl.java:90)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver.checkSprintAccessible(SprintResolver.java:31)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver$SprintAccessible.apply(SprintResolver.java:139)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver$SprintAccessible.apply(SprintResolver.java:125)
com.google.common.base.Predicates$AndPredicate.apply(Predicates.java:353) {code}
The bottleneck appears to be in the following code which will fetch all Sprints available to the user
{code:java}
  Set<Sprint> allMatches = check(sprintHelper.findSprintPickerAllMatches(user, suggestions, searchQuery, maxResults, excludeCompleted));{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 500 Sprint with 50,000 issues each (to exaggerate the problem)
 # Go to Issue Navigator > Click on Sprint dropdown
 # Notice the dropdown appear slowly 

h3. Expected Results

A dropdown appears reasonably instantly. 
h3. Actual Results

In the extreme, where Jira instance has 3.5M issues and a lot of Sprint, this sprint picker field can take up to 2 minutes to return:
{noformat}
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:08:02:47 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581667257699 HTTP/1.1" 200 1233 93952 "https://localhost/jira/browse/FBVRDS-1449" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:08:02:12 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581667222695 HTTP/1.1" 200 1233 95313 "https://localhost/jira/browse/FBVRDS-1448" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:08:01:04 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581667061798 HTTP/1.1" 200 1213 126270 "https://localhost/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=88532&selectedIssue=CMBGSAI-10743&quickFilter=129584&quickFilter=142240" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:08:01:03 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581592861732 HTTP/1.1" 200 1262 130847 "https://localhost/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=43317&projectKey=HMS&view=planning.nodetail&selectedIssue=HMS-7980&issueLimit=100" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:08:00:57 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=s&_=1581667061799 HTTP/1.1" 200 1185 118021 "https://localhost/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=88532&selectedIssue=CMBGSAI-10743&quickFilter=129584&quickFilter=142240" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:07:56:12 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581666825794 HTTP/1.1" 200 1255 94268 "https://localhost/jira/browse/GCM-8057" 
xxx.xxx.xxx [14/Feb/2020:07:23:57 +0000] "GET /jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/picker?query=&_=1581664229894 HTTP/1.1" 200 1329 101854 "https://localhost/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa" 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 - Instead of using the basic JQL search function that allows for the dropdown, switch to the "Advanced" JQL view. When typing out the sprint name, Jira will provide a relevant list of suggestions.
fields.summary: Sprint picker field causing too much CPU

fields.description:
_NB: This feature suggestion is for "Automation for Jira", but I haven't been able to create the ticket there. The reason is when creating an issue, the "Component/s" field is mandatory but there is no "Component/s" values available in "Automation for Jira" project._

For the moment, the entry in issue history for Automation changes has nothing specific, there is no difference between an automatic and a manual change. It's as if the "Actor" of the rule has made manual changes to the issue (leading to questions by suspicious colleagues like "Why did you make such and such changes to this ticket? - I never even seen your tickets... Oh wait.").

It would be great to have a reference to the Automation rule in issue "History" tab (or somewhere else), so that:
 * users know that the changes were made by an automated rule
 * we can easily track down a rule causing undesired side effects

!image-2020-02-17-15-13-23-398.png|width=622,height=168!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA doesn't detect changes to the pull request title unless an update is made to the PR itself in GHE, i.e. a merge or closure. This is problematic if you want to associate the PR to a JIRA issue and forget to add the ticket key, so if you go back to GitHub after the PR was created and JIRA has already written the data to AO_E8B6CC_PULL_REQUEST, you will need to merge or close the PR in order to sync the PR with the key 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # link JIRA with a GH or GHE org
 # create a PR in one of the repos
# sync the repo with JIRA
# go back into GitHub and update title with a JIRA issue key
# peform a full sync in JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA would sync the update to the PR and create a link to the issue 
h3. Actual Results
The data in AO_E8B6CC_PULL_REQUEST is not updated and the issue is not linked to the PR


h3. Workaround
You will need to wait until the PR is either merged to closed at this point it should pick up the change in the next sync.
fields.summary: JIRA does not pickup GH/GHE Pull Request title updates unless an action is performed on the Pull Request

h3. Problem Definition
The *Issue Detail View* is only accessible from the board configuration and not linked to the project screen scheme.

However, that makes it difficult to manage. I currently have one screen scheme that I use for all my scrum team projects. When I add a new field to my screen scheme, I many times would like it to appear on the "Issue Detail View". But, to make that happen I have to edit a couple of board configurations, instead of just making it in one place, like when I add the field to my common screen scheme.

h3. Suggested Solution
We need a way to link *Issue Detail View* from Board configuration to the Project *Screen Scheme*.
fields.summary: Possibility to link "Issue Detail View" to the project screen scheme.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Ability to add Number Custom fields in the Two Dimensional filter gadget.
For example like Story Point
fields.summary: Ability to add Number Custom fields in the Two Dimensional filter gadget. For example like Story Point

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There needs to a way to thread comments in Jira for on premise instances. Jira comments are horrible to work with since there is no threading.

 

Most communication applications have some form of threading, including Slack.
fields.summary: Multithreaded comments for JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently when moving a story having some subtask into an epic requires lot of extra and error prone steps to get the subtask of the initial story moved into stories related into the new epic.

This should be automated.

 

Additionally it would be great when the epic name could be (optionally) filled with the summary, so that there is no extra step required when moving the epic itself.
fields.summary: When moving a story into an epic the related subtask should be automatically moved into stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Right now there is only one way to context a field for project(Choosing each project in "Configure"). For the high usage instances, it is difficult to choose the respective projects if there are multiple projects to be added to context.

It would be more helpful if "*Project Category*" be added in context configuration. 

Benefits:

1) Direct – It'll save more manual effort of adding each project to context.

2) Indirect – It'll also improve Jira admins to follow best practice, by not globally adding custom fields(Performance improvement). 

 

Looking forward for the feature addition! :)(flag)
fields.summary: "Project Category" to be added in custom field context

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The last version of the documentation release for the Projects gadget was released on Jira 6.4. However, when we attempt to install this gadget it behaves erratically and does not display all functionalities presented in the article.

Can we review and update the documentation related to this gadget?

Kind regards,

Gregory Peres
Jira Server Support
fields.summary: Review the documentation for the Projects gadget.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*+Summary+*
When selecting a version in a scrum backlog and viewing the epics, the irrelevant epics will be shown as grayed out. We would like to have the ability to hide irrelevant epics when selecting a version in Scrum backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to hide irrelevant epics when selecting a version in Scrum backlog.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to [Jira Server Mobile App Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/jira-software-mobile-app-966063511.html] the Mobile app is only available for instances 8.3+.

Customers with previous versions request retro compatibility and/or workaround to be able to use the app.

*Current option available*: Upgrade to Jira 8.3
fields.summary: Add Jira mobile compatibility to Jira versions earlier than 8.3
